docs.lead_paragraph: A family doctor in rural Kansas says her switch to electronic records has greatly improved her productivity.

headline.seo: Rural Doctor Finds Benefits in Electronic Medical Records

docs.lead_paragraph: When given a chance, many people still seem to forget to tell the I.R.S. about some of their undocumented income.

docs.lead_paragraph: Tubal ligation is more popular than vasectomies for men, but is difficult to reverse. Pills and intrauterine devices can prevent pregnancy while preserving fertility.
docs.snippet: Tubal ligation is more popular than vasectomies for men, but is difficult to reverse. Pills and intrauterine devices can prevent pregnancy while preserving fertility.

docs.lead_paragraph: Once you’ve decided to get a vasectomy, a little research may help bring the cost down.

docs.lead_paragraph: Anecdotal evidence supports the intuition that more people might hesitate to expand their families during a downturn.

docs.lead_paragraph: Uwe Reinhardt wrote earlier today about how much it would cost to restructure the health care system by creating a Medicare-like health plan for the non-elderly. If you did not like his design, perhaps you should come up with one of your own.

headline.main: Designing a New Health Care System

docs.abstract: The X Prize Foundation and WellPoint are offering a $10 million prize for the best way to revamp the U.S. health care system.
docs.snippet: The X Prize Foundation and WellPoint are offering a $10 million prize for the best way to revamp the U.S. health care system.

docs.lead_paragraph: Thanks to everyone who sent in resources for estimating the effective total tax rate paid by various income quintiles. You have found some fascinating stuff, so here's a roundup of some of your recommendations:

headline.main: More on Income Levels and Tax Rates

docs.lead_paragraph: Following is the third and final set of answers from Jacquie Berger, the executive director of Just Food, a nonprofit organization that works to develop a just and sustainable food system in the New York City region. She will be answering selected readers' questions about community-supported agriculture and other ways to access farm-fresh produce as well as urban food-growing opportunities in New York's communities.

headline.main: Answers About Local Food in New York, Part 3

docs.abstract: Taking Questions: Jacquie Berger, executive director of Just Food, a nonprofit organization that works to develop a just and sustainable food system in the region, is answering readers' questions this week.
docs.snippet: Taking Questions: Jacquie Berger, executive director of Just Food, a nonprofit organization that works to develop a just and sustainable food system in the region, is answering readers' questions this week.

docs.lead_paragraph: Uwe E. Reinhardt is an economics professor at Princeton.

headline.main: Pricing a Medicare-Like Public Health Plan

docs.abstract: A public policy research organization recently estimated the costs of creating a Medicare-like plan for the non-elderly, an economist writes.
